trans-unit.source: Using root privileges on Linux virtual machines in Azure
trans-unit.target: Using root privileges on Linux virtual machines in Azure

trans-unit.source: By default, the `root` user is disabled on Linux virtual machines in Azure.
trans-unit.target: By default, the `root` user is disabled on Linux virtual machines in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Users can run commands with elevated privileges by using the `sudo` command.
trans-unit.target: Users can run commands with elevated privileges by using the `sudo` command.

trans-unit.source: However, the experience may vary depending on how the system was provisioned.
trans-unit.target: However, the experience may vary depending on how the system was provisioned.

trans-unit.source: **SSH key and password OR password only** - the virtual machine was provisioned with either a certificate (`.CER` file) or SSH key as well as a password, or just a user name and password.
trans-unit.target: **SSH key and password OR password only** - the virtual machine was provisioned with either a certificate (`.CER` file) or SSH key as well as a password, or just a user name and password.

trans-unit.source: In this case `sudo` will prompt for the user's password before executing the command.
trans-unit.target: In this case `sudo` will prompt for the user's password before executing the command.

trans-unit.source: **SSH key only** - the virtual machine was provisioned with a certificate (`.cer` or `.pem` file) or SSH key, but no password.
trans-unit.target: **SSH key only** - the virtual machine was provisioned with a certificate (`.cer` or `.pem` file) or SSH key, but no password.

trans-unit.source: In this case `sudo` **will not** prompt for the user's password before executing the command.
trans-unit.target: In this case `sudo` **will not** prompt for the user's password before executing the command.
